technical.title: Built on Open Standards
technical.vrm_description: Created by the VRM Consortium, VRM is an extended version of glTF designed specifically for humanoid avatars. Think of it as the "JPEG of 3D" for virtual characters, adding powerful features for animation and interaction.
technical.features_intro: The format extends glTF with specialized components:

vrm_features.skeleton: Standardized humanoid skeletal structure for consistent animation
vrm_features.materials: Advanced material definitions for consistent cross-platform rendering
vrm_features.expressions: Built-in facial expression and blendshape control system
vrm_features.eye_movement: Integrated look-at and eye movement parameters
vrm_features.vr: First-person view optimizations for VR applications
